column5: Has anybody used it? Looks awesome! A cell sized aqua-vu! Very much want to order one but hoped to get some real life reviews before dropping $400.
Ouch, $400 for something that probably costs $25, lol.
seems like alot of $$$ to watch a cell phone sized screen....

I've read a few comments on other sites, the most mentioned is it only has a 50' cable which limits your depth.  Second is the lack of a power port to provide backup power when the battery depletes.  Battery is supposed to be good for about 6 hours.   Other than that, most seem to like the clarity and small size for portability.  I almost bought one at the x-mas sale at Tromblys, but like usual, wrong item and wrong price.
Cabela's.ca has Aqua-Vu Micro priced at $319.99 Haven't used it so can't give any kind of review to help you.   This one isn't the + version.
lol wrong price there I bet....
Im a little sketched out with "aqua vu" seeing as it seems like ownership has bounced around a few times lately, so I dont know of the long term quality on these puppies
It'd be nice if they sold the camera / cable on its own and teamed it with a smartphone app. THAT would be ultimate.

The + version does have AC input, AND video output for recording or transferring to a larger screen (tablet etc). The 50' cable will be 30' too much for almost all my fishing trips, so that doesnt bother me.
